article.headline: Drake 90, Akron 88
article.story: DES MOINES, Iowa (AP) -- Aliou Keita's two free throws with 51 seconds left gave Drake the lead and Lonnie Randolph's free throw with 12 seconds remaining sealed a 90-88 victory over Akron Friday. Randolph led the Bulldogs (1-0) with 22 points and made all five of his 3-pointers. Klayton Korver had 17. Keita, a transfer from Tulsa, had 11 points and eight rebounds. The Zips (0-1) took an 88-84 lead with 1:27 left on a six-footer by Darryl Peterson who finished with 18 points. But a Korver 3-pointer brought Drake within one at 89-88. Peterson's 3-point attempt at the buzzer was long. Both teams were hot from 3-point range with the Bulldogs connecting on 12 of 19 and the Zips 15 of 31, including 11 of 18 in the second half. Bubba Walther led Akron with 21 points and Peterson had 18. Drake used a 15-1 run to turn a 9-7 lead into a 24-8 cushion with 15:08 left in the first half behind three 3-pointers and a layup by Randolph. Then the Zips had a 13-3 run of their own to cut the deficit to 27-24. Peterson scored seven points including a 3-pointer during the stretch. Drake led 47-42 at halftime.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
